intro: Godetia lepida, commonly known as the slender godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
